intro: Ornithogalum miniatum var. vandermerwei, commonly known as the dwarf star of Bethlehem, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming leaves. The plant produces delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a container plant.
